member.name: T:Priority_Queue.HeapPriorityQueue`1
member.summary: An implementation of a min-Priority Queue using a heap. Has O(1) .Contains()! See https://bitbucket.org/BlueRaja/high-speed-priority-queue-for-c/wiki/Getting%20Started for more information
member.typeparam: The values in the queue. Must implement the PriorityQueueNode interface

member.name: T:Priority_Queue.IPriorityQueue`1
member.summary: The IPriorityQueue interface. This is mainly here for purists, and in case I decide to add more implementations later. For speed purposes, it is actually recommended that you *don't* access the priority queue through this interface, since the JIT can (theoretically?) optimize method calls from concrete-types slightly better.

member.name: M:Priority_Queue.HeapPriorityQueue`1.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiate a new Priority Queue
member.param: The max nodes ever allowed to be enqueued (going over this will cause an exception)

member.name: M:Priority_Queue.HeapPriorityQueue`1.Clear
member.summary: Removes every node from the queue. O(n) (So, don't do this often!)

member.name: M:Priority_Queue.HeapPriorityQueue`1.Contains(`0)
member.summary: Returns (in O(1)!) whether the given node is in the queue. O(1)

member.name: M:Priority_Queue.HeapPriorityQueue`1.Enqueue(`0,System.Double)
member.summary: Enqueue a node - .Priority must be set beforehand! O(log n)

member.name: M:Priority_Queue.HeapPriorityQueue`1.HasHigherPriority(`0,`0)
member.summary: Returns true if 'higher' has higher priority than 'lower', false otherwise. Note that calling HasHigherPriority(node, node) (ie. both arguments the same node) will return false

member.name: M:Priority_Queue.HeapPriorityQueue`1.Dequeue
member.summary: Removes the head of the queue (node with highest priority; ties are broken by order of insertion), and returns it. O(log n)

member.name: M:Priority_Queue.HeapPriorityQueue`1.UpdatePriority(`0,System.Double)
member.summary: This method must be called on a node every time its priority changes while it is in the queue. Forgetting to call this method will result in a corrupted queue! O(log n)

member.name: M:Priority_Queue.HeapPriorityQueue`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes a node from the queue. Note that the node does not need to be the head of the queue. O(log n)

member.name: M:Priority_Queue.HeapPriorityQueue`1.IsValidQueue
member.summary: Should not be called in production code. Checks to make sure the queue is still in a valid state. Used for testing/debugging the queue.

member.name: P:Priority_Queue.HeapPriorityQueue`1.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of nodes in the queue. O(1)

member.name: P:Priority_Queue.HeapPriorityQueue`1.MaxSize
member.summary: Returns the maximum number of items that can be enqueued at once in this queue. Once you hit this number (ie. once Count == MaxSize), attempting to enqueue another item will throw an exception. O(1)

member.name: P:Priority_Queue.HeapPriorityQueue`1.First
member.summary: Returns the head of the queue, without removing it (use Dequeue() for that). O(1)

member.name: P:Priority_Queue.PriorityQueueNode.Priority
member.summary: The Priority to insert this node at. Must be set BEFORE adding a node to the queue

member.name: P:Priority_Queue.PriorityQueueNode.InsertionIndex
member.summary: Used by the priority queue - do not edit this value. Represents the order the node was inserted in

member.name: P:Priority_Queue.PriorityQueueNode.QueueIndex
member.summary: Used by the priority queue - do not edit this value. Represents the current position in the queue
